title: Google makes offer to buy Fitbit: sources
text:
Google’s parent Alphabet is in the running to acquire Fitbit.

Sources tell Reuters Google has made an offer, as it considers jumping into the crowded market for fitness trackers and smartwatches.

Fitbit shares rose 27% on the news, giving the company a market capitalization of $1.4 billion.

But - there is no certainty that the negotiations between Google and Fitbit will lead to a deal.

Both companies declined to comment. And the exact price Google has offered for Fitbit remains unclear.

A deal for Fitbit’s devices - which monitors users’ daily steps, calories burned and other lifestyle stats - comes as its dominant share of the fitness tracking sector continues to be chipped away by cheaper competitor products.

Fitbit cut its 2019 revenue forecast in July, blaming disappointing sales of its newly launched smartwatch Versa Lite.
